clusters.title: 'Starmer's big Gaza gamble' and 'Maga send-off'
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Recognizes Palestine, Other Nations Follow Suit

items.title: 'Starmer's big Gaza gamble' and 'Maga send-off'
items.standfirst: The UK's recognition of Palestinian statehood and Charlie Kirk's memorial dominate Monday's papers.
items.content: The UK's recognition of Palestinian statehood and Charlie Kirk's memorial dominate Monday's papers.

items.title: Israel continuing assault on Gaza after U.K. and others recognize Palestinian statehood
items.standfirst: The United Kingdom, Canada and Australia officially recognized Palestine as a state Sunday, a move that has long been opposed by the U.S. and Israel. More countries are expected to do the same this week as world leaders gather in New York for the U.N. General Assembly. Seth Doane in Tel Aviv has more.
items.content: The United Kingdom, Canada and Australia officially recognized Palestine as a state Sunday, a move that has long been opposed by the U.S. and Israel. More countries are expected to do the same this week as world leaders gather in New York for the U.N. General Assembly. Seth Doane in Tel Aviv has more.

items.title: UK formally recognises Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Canada, Australia and Portugal also announced the move on Sunday, with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu accusing leaders of giving a "huge reward to terrorism".
items.content: Canada, Australia and Portugal also announced the move on Sunday, with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu accusing leaders of giving a "huge reward to terrorism".

items.title: UK recognises state of Palestine to ‘keep alive’ the possibility of peace
items.standfirst: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...
items.content: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...

items.title: How will recognition of Palestinian statehood be greeted in the UK?
items.standfirst: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...
items.content: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...

items.title: U.K. formally recognizes Palestinian state
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: Watch: Keir Starmer says UK recognises Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Starmer says the move will "revive the hope of peace" but Israel says it is "nothing but a reward for jihadist Hamas".
items.content: Prime Minister Starmer says the move will "revive the hope of peace" but Israel says it is "nothing but a reward for jihadist Hamas".

items.title: British PM Starmer says "two-state solution is the best hope for peace and security"
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has issued a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes Britain the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has condemned the move, voicing strong criticism. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports on the reaction in the United Kingdom.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has issued a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes Britain the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has condemned the move, voicing strong criticism. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports on the reaction in the United Kingdom.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state in major diplomatic shift
items.standfirst: Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. Professor of International Politics and Middle East Studies at Lancaster University, Simon Mabon, provides further explanations.
items.content: Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. Professor of International Politics and Middle East Studies at Lancaster University, Simon Mabon, provides further explanations.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state: Move opposed by Israel and US
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France24 International Affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details on this western diplomatic shift and reactions.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France24 International Affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details on this western diplomatic shift and reactions.

items.title: UK recognises Palestine: A diplomatic failure for Israeli PM Netanyahu
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. France 24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem on the reactions among Israelis and the perception of a diplomatic setback for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. France 24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem on the reactions among Israelis and the perception of a diplomatic setback for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

items.title: UK announces recognition of State of Palestine
items.standfirst: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced the United Kingdom’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood.
items.content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced the United Kingdom’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood.

items.title: UK recognises Palestine: West Bank welcomes the move
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France 24’s Senior Reporter Catherine Norris Trent has the latest from Ramallah in the West Bank.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France 24’s Senior Reporter Catherine Norris Trent has the latest from Ramallah in the West Bank.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian State: British PM Starmer delivers a video-message
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer shared a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media, in which he announced that the United Kingdom officially recognises the State of Palestine. The UK becomes the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to recognise Palestine, collectively known as the occupied Palestinian territories. International affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer shared a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media, in which he announced that the United Kingdom officially recognises the State of Palestine. The UK becomes the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to recognise Palestine, collectively known as the occupied Palestinian territories. International affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state in major diplomatic shift
items.standfirst: United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state, with a videomessage pre-recorded by the British Prime Minister Keir Starmer which will significantly change the foreign policy of the country. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports the latest from London.
items.content: United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state, with a videomessage pre-recorded by the British Prime Minister Keir Starmer which will significantly change the foreign policy of the country. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports the latest from London.

items.title: United Kingdom: British PM Starmer prepares to recognise Palestinian state
items.standfirst: The United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state via a pre-recorded video message from Prime Minister Keir Starmer, marking a significant shift in the country’s foreign policy. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London on the political and public reactions
items.content: The United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state via a pre-recorded video message from Prime Minister Keir Starmer, marking a significant shift in the country’s foreign policy. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London on the political and public reactions

items.title: Western shift: UK and Portugal to recognise Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Britain and Portugal are set to recognise the State of Palestine on Sunday, ahead of a key week at the UN General Assembly in New York, where around 10 countries may follow suit to pressure Israel over Gaza. UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. Professor of law, conflict and global development at the University of Reading, Rosa Freedman, joins us for more.
items.content: Britain and Portugal are set to recognise the State of Palestine on Sunday, ahead of a key week at the UN General Assembly in New York, where around 10 countries may follow suit to pressure Israel over Gaza. UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. Professor of law, conflict and global development at the University of Reading, Rosa Freedman, joins us for more.

items.title: UK officially recognises Palestine as a state
items.standfirst: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.
items.content: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.

items.title: Will Benjamin Netanyahu annex the West Bank?
items.standfirst: Israeli PM is under pressure from far-right coalition partners to formally seize parts of occupied Palestinian territory
items.content: Israeli PM is under pressure from far-right coalition partners to formally seize parts of occupied Palestinian territory

ai_summary: The United Kingdom formally recognized Palestine as an independent state, a symbolic move.
Canada and Australia also announced their recognition of Palestine on Sunday.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized the recognition as rewarding terrorism.
The move is a major foreign policy shift for the Labour government in the UK.
World leaders are gathering in New York for the UN General Assembly this week.

items.title: 'I forgive him': Erika Kirk addresses the alleged killer of her late husband
items.standfirst: Erika Kirk speaks at her husband Charlie Kirk’s memorial saying through tears that she forgives her husband’s alleged killer. “I forgive him. I forgive him because it was what Christ did and what Charlie would do.”
items.content: Erika Kirk speaks at her husband Charlie Kirk’s memorial saying through tears that she forgives her husband’s alleged killer. “I forgive him. I forgive him because it was what Christ did and what Charlie would do.”

items.content: Elon Musk took a seat beside President Trump in his private box during a memorial for Charlie Kirk. The interaction marked the first public sighting of Musk and Trump together in months.

items.title: Trump calls Kirk ‘martyr’ as his wife forgives shooter
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump proclaimed Charlie Kirk a “martyr for American freedom” in a memorial ceremony to commemorate the political activist as Erika Kirk said she forgave the man who gunned down her husband. “On that day, this evangelist for American liberty became immortal,” Trump said Sunday…
items.content: President Donald Trump proclaimed Charlie Kirk a “martyr for American freedom” in a memorial ceremony to commemorate the political activist as Erika Kirk said she forgave the man who gunned down her husband. “On that day, this evangelist for American liberty became immortal,” Trump said Sunday…

items.title: Trump officials praise Charlie Kirk's faith and his mark on the conservative movement
Trump rails against opponents in Kirk tribute after widow says she forgives shooting suspect – as it happened
items.standfirst: This blog is now closed.Full report: Trump pays tribute to Charlie Kirk as tens of thousands attend memorialErika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, says she forgives man accused of murderCharlie Kirk funeral mixes rally and revival as mourners vow to spread Maga messageChristian nationalists in the US are positioning Charlie Kirk as a martyr for their movement, one that has grown in popularity and whose rise was intertwined with Kirk’s own political ascent.After Kirk’s killing, his widow, Erika Kirk, wrote on social media that the “world is evil”, but God “so good”. The “sound of this widow weeping [echoes] throughout this world like a battle cry,” she said. “They have no idea what they just ignited within this wife.”“Last week, we brought my dear friend Charlie Kirk home one last time. Today, we return to Arizona to remember Charlie and honor his sacrifice. May he eternally rest in peace, and may God watch over Erika and their beautiful children.” Continue reading...
items.content: This blog is now closed.Full report: Trump pays tribute to Charlie Kirk as tens of thousands attend memorialErika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, says she forgives man accused of murderCharlie Kirk funeral mixes rally and revival as mourners vow to spread Maga messageChristian nationalists in the US are positioning Charlie Kirk as a martyr for their movement, one that has grown in popularity and whose rise was intertwined with Kirk’s own political ascent.After Kirk’s killing, his widow, Erika Kirk, wrote on social media that the “world is evil”, but God “so good”. The “sound of this widow weeping [echoes] throughout this world like a battle cry,” she said. “They have no idea what they just ignited within this wife.”“Last week, we brought my dear friend Charlie Kirk home one last time. Today, we return to Arizona to remember Charlie and honor his sacrifice. May he eternally rest in peace, and may God watch over Erika and their beautiful children.” Continue reading...

items.title: Vance puts Charlie Kirk’s Christian faith front and center – with an eye on 2028
items.standfirst: Vice-president was in confessional mode as he eulogized his friend in Arizona – but speech could have political utility tooJD Vance went into confessional mode. “I was telling somebody backstage that I always felt a little uncomfortable talking about my faith in public,” he said. “As much as I love the Lord, and as much as it was an important part of my life, I have talked more about Jesus Christ in the past two weeks than I have my entire time in public life.”The crowd at rightwing political activist Charlie Kirk’s memorial service at a football stadium in Glendale, Arizona on Sunday rose to its feet and roared its approval. Continue reading...
items.content: Vice-president was in confessional mode as he eulogized his friend in Arizona – but speech could have political utility tooJD Vance went into confessional mode. “I was telling somebody backstage that I always felt a little uncomfortable talking about my faith in public,” he said. “As much as I love the Lord, and as much as it was an important part of my life, I have talked more about Jesus Christ in the past two weeks than I have my entire time in public life.”The crowd at rightwing political activist Charlie Kirk’s memorial service at a football stadium in Glendale, Arizona on Sunday rose to its feet and roared its approval. Continue reading...

items.title: Charlie Kirk honored by Trump & Republican leaders at memorial service
items.standfirst: President Trump joined thousands of supporters at State Farm Stadium in Arizona to honor the life and legacy of conservative activist Charlie Kirk nearly two weeks after he was assassinated. NBC News’ Garrett Haake reports.
items.content: President Trump joined thousands of supporters at State Farm Stadium in Arizona to honor the life and legacy of conservative activist Charlie Kirk nearly two weeks after he was assassinated. NBC News’ Garrett Haake reports.

items.title: Charlie Kirk memorial: Trump says he ‘hates’ his opponents at event attended by tens of thousands
items.standfirst: President delivers mix of eulogy and campaign speech while JD Vance calls Kirk ‘martyr for the Christian faith’Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, says she forgives man accused of murderVance puts Charlie Kirk’s Christian faith front and center – with an eye on 2028Donald Trump told a crowd of thousands that he “hates” his opponents at a public memorial to honor the rightwing youth organizer Charlie Kirk, even after Kirk’s widow said she forgives the man charged with fatally shooting her husband during an event at a Utah college.Tens of thousands gathered at the event in Arizona on Sunday, with the president giving the last of more than two dozen speeches, after emotional remarks from Kirk’s widow, Erika, and eulogies from the vice-president, JD Vance, four cabinet members and other senior White House officials, a reflection of the murdered activist’s deep imprint on the president’s Make America Great Again (Maga) movement. Continue reading...
items.content: President delivers mix of eulogy and campaign speech while JD Vance calls Kirk ‘martyr for the Christian faith’Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, says she forgives man accused of murderVance puts Charlie Kirk’s Christian faith front and center – with an eye on 2028Donald Trump told a crowd of thousands that he “hates” his opponents at a public memorial to honor the rightwing youth organizer Charlie Kirk, even after Kirk’s widow said she forgives the man charged with fatally shooting her husband during an event at a Utah college.Tens of thousands gathered at the event in Arizona on Sunday, with the president giving the last of more than two dozen speeches, after emotional remarks from Kirk’s widow, Erika, and eulogies from the vice-president, JD Vance, four cabinet members and other senior White House officials, a reflection of the murdered activist’s deep imprint on the president’s Make America Great Again (Maga) movement. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump shares the topic on which he disagreed with Kirk
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Charlie Kirk wanted “the best” for his opponents, but that’s where he “disagreed” with Kirk. “I don’t want the best for them,” Trump said while speaking at a memorial for the conservative activist.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Charlie Kirk wanted “the best” for his opponents, but that’s where he “disagreed” with Kirk. “I don’t want the best for them,” Trump said while speaking at a memorial for the conservative activist.

items.title: One of the last things Charlie Kirk said to Trump
items.standfirst: President Trump shared one of the last things he says Charlie Kirk told him while speaking at his memorial: "Please sir, save Chicago."
items.content: President Trump shared one of the last things he says Charlie Kirk told him while speaking at his memorial: "Please sir, save Chicago."

items.title: Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, says she forgives man accused of murder
items.standfirst: Wife of activist killed in Utah, allegedly by Tyler Robinson, 22, says ‘I forgive him because it was what Christ did’During an emotional address at his public memorial in Glendale, Arizona, the widow of rightwing youth organizer Charlie Kirk said she forgives the man charged with killing her husband.“My husband, he wanted to save young men, just like the one who took his life,” Erika Kirk said, before an at-capacity crowd. “That man, that young man – I forgive him. I forgive him because it was what Christ did, and it is what Charlie would do.” Continue reading...
items.content: Wife of activist killed in Utah, allegedly by Tyler Robinson, 22, says ‘I forgive him because it was what Christ did’During an emotional address at his public memorial in Glendale, Arizona, the widow of rightwing youth organizer Charlie Kirk said she forgives the man charged with killing her husband.“My husband, he wanted to save young men, just like the one who took his life,” Erika Kirk said, before an at-capacity crowd. “That man, that young man – I forgive him. I forgive him because it was what Christ did, and it is what Charlie would do.” Continue reading...

items.title: Charlie Kirk memorial mixes rally and revival as mourners vow to spread Maga message
items.standfirst: Emotions were raw as service began with Christian worship songs – and ended with a political speech from the presidentHours before the sun rose over the Arizona desert, tens of thousands of mourners snaked through the Valley toward the State Farm stadium in Glendale – where the conservative activist Charlie Kirk was lionized as a “prophet” for the streaming era and a defender of free speech, martyred in the line of duty.The memorial was part spiritual revival and part political rally, with a program that included Donald Trump and prominent members of the president’s Make America Great Again (Maga) movement. Mourners obliged the red, white and blue “Sunday best” dress code, filling the at-capacity venue with stars, stripes and Maga hats. Continue reading...
items.content: Emotions were raw as service began with Christian worship songs – and ended with a political speech from the presidentHours before the sun rose over the Arizona desert, tens of thousands of mourners snaked through the Valley toward the State Farm stadium in Glendale – where the conservative activist Charlie Kirk was lionized as a “prophet” for the streaming era and a defender of free speech, martyred in the line of duty.The memorial was part spiritual revival and part political rally, with a program that included Donald Trump and prominent members of the president’s Make America Great Again (Maga) movement. Mourners obliged the red, white and blue “Sunday best” dress code, filling the at-capacity venue with stars, stripes and Maga hats. Continue reading...

items.content: The issue affecting check-in and baggage systems caused hundreds of delays and cancellations on Saturday.

items.title: Disruption continues at Heathrow, Brussels and Berlin airports after cyber-attack
items.standfirst: Zaventem asks airlines to cancel half of Monday departures, while most of Heathrow flights expected to operate Hundreds of thousands of passengers at Heathrow and Berlin airports faced flight delays on Sunday after a cyber-attack hit check-in desk software, while cancellations at Brussels airport suggested that disruption of Europe’s air travel would continue into Monday.Airlines were forced to revert to slower manual check-ins from Friday night after the attack hit Collins Aerospace, which provides check-in desk technology to various airlines. Continue reading...
items.content: Zaventem asks airlines to cancel half of Monday departures, while most of Heathrow flights expected to operate Hundreds of thousands of passengers at Heathrow and Berlin airports faced flight delays on Sunday after a cyber-attack hit check-in desk software, while cancellations at Brussels airport suggested that disruption of Europe’s air travel would continue into Monday.Airlines were forced to revert to slower manual check-ins from Friday night after the attack hit Collins Aerospace, which provides check-in desk technology to various airlines. items.title: European airports scramble to get back online after cyberattack on check-in systems
items.standfirst: Several of Europe's biggest airports including London Heathrow raced to restore normal operations on Sunday after hackersdisrupted automatic check-in systems, causing a second day of delays and cancellations and forcing Brussels airport to scrap half of Monday's scheduled departing flights.
items.content: Several of Europe's biggest airports including London Heathrow raced to restore normal operations on Sunday after hackersdisrupted automatic check-in systems, causing a second day of delays and cancellations and forcing Brussels airport to scrap half of Monday's scheduled departing flights.

items.title: German jets scrambled after Russian military plane flies over Baltic Sea
items.standfirst: Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane ignored requests to make contact, in latest of what are seen as provocative acts by KremlinTwo German Eurofighter jets were scrambled on Sunday to intercept a Russian military aircraft above the Baltic Sea, as Estonia said it would call an emergency meeting of the UN security council after Russian planes violated its airspace.Germany’s air force said the Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane had switched off its transponders and ignored requests to make contact. The Eurofighters took off from the Rostock-Laage airbase to head off the aircraft as it flew in international airspace. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane ignored requests to make contact, in latest of what are seen as provocative acts by KremlinTwo German Eurofighter jets were scrambled on Sunday to intercept a Russian military aircraft above the Baltic Sea, as Estonia said it would call an emergency meeting of the UN security council after Russian planes violated its airspace.Germany’s air force said the Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane had switched off its transponders and ignored requests to make contact. The Eurofighters took off from the Rostock-Laage airbase to head off the aircraft as it flew in international airspace. Continue reading...

items.title: Philippines: Thousands march in Manila protesting corruption, clashing with authorities
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Manila to protest a corruption scandal involving flood control projects worth billions of dollars, leading to scattered clashes with police. With organizers aiming for one of the largest anti-corruption turnouts, authorities deployed police and soldiers on Sunday to prevent potential violence. Florent Marchais has this story.
items.content: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Manila to protest a corruption scandal involving flood control projects worth billions of dollars, leading to scattered clashes with police. items.title: Israeli drone strike in Lebanon 'kills five people including three children'
items.standfirst: An Israeli drone strike in southern Lebanon has killed five people including three children, the country's health ministry said.
items.content: An Israeli drone strike in southern Lebanon has killed five people including three children, the country's health ministry said.

items.title: US children among five killed in Israeli drone strike on southern Lebanon
items.standfirst: Israel says Hezbollah member killed in strike, but Lebanon says attack is a 'crime against civilians'.
items.content: Israel says Hezbollah member killed in strike, but Lebanon says attack is a 'crime against civilians'.

ai_summary: An Israeli drone strike in southern Lebanon killed five people.
The strike included the deaths of three children.
Israel claims a Hezbollah member was killed in the strike.
Lebanon states the attack was a crime against civilians.
The incident occurred in southern Lebanon.

items.content: There has been strong opposition against the airport wanting to use its northern runway.

items.title: Gatwick given green light for £2.2bn second runway plan
items.standfirst: Heidi Alexander approves expansion to allow 100,000 more flights a yearGatwick airport’s £2.2bn second runway plan has been given the go-ahead by the transport secretary, Heidi Alexander.With the privately financed project, the West Sussex hub is aiming to increase its capacity by 100,000 flights a year. Continue reading...
items.content: Heidi Alexander approves expansion to allow 100,000 more flights a yearGatwick airport’s £2.2bn second runway plan has been given the go-ahead by the transport secretary, Heidi Alexander.With the privately financed project, the West Sussex hub is aiming to increase its capacity by 100,000 flights a year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The transport secretary approved Gatwick Airport's second runway plan.
The project is valued at £2.2 billion.
The expansion will allow for 100,000 more flights annually.
There was strong opposition to the airport's northern runway usage.
The project is privately financed.

items.title: Taliban rejects Trump's bid to take over Afghan air base once controlled by U.S.
items.standfirst: President Trump is renewing his call to reestablish a U.S. presence at Bagram, even saying "we're talking now to Afghanistan" about the matter.
items.content: President Trump is renewing his call to reestablish a U.S. presence at Bagram, even saying "we're talking now to Afghanistan" about the matter.

items.title: Afghan Taliban rejects Trump threats over taking back Bagram airbase
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump has pushed for regaining Bagram airbase, citing proximity to China's nuclear facilities.
items.content: US President Donald Trump has pushed for regaining Bagram airbase, citing proximity to China's nuclear facilities.

ai_summary: President Trump is pushing to reestablish a U.S. presence at Bagram airbase.
Trump mentioned discussing the matter with Afghanistan.
The Taliban rejected Trump's proposal regarding the airbase.
Trump cited the proximity of the airbase to China's nuclear facilities.
The Taliban's rejection is a response to Trump's efforts.

items.title: Email calling Jeffrey Epstein a 'supreme friend' adds new fuel to royal scandal
items.standfirst: A newly surfaced email revealed that Sarah Ferguson, the Duchess of York, described Jeffrey Epstein as a “supreme friend” despite his conviction for sex offences.
items.content: A newly surfaced email revealed that Sarah Ferguson, the Duchess of York, described Jeffrey Epstein as a “supreme friend” despite his conviction for sex offences.

items.title: Duchess of York called Epstein 'supreme friend' in 2011 email
items.standfirst: A spokesperson for the duchess says the message was sent to counter a threat Epstein had made to sue her for defamation.
items.content: A spokesperson for the duchess says the message was sent to counter a threat Epstein had made to sue her for defamation.

ai_summary: Sarah Ferguson described Jeffrey Epstein as a "supreme friend" in an email.
The email was recently revealed.
The email was sent in 2011.
The duchess's spokesperson said the email countered a threat.
Epstein had threatened to sue her for defamation.

items.content: After it was barred from the Eurovision Song Contest Russia is reviving a Soviet-era version of the camp competition.

The BBC's Steve Rosenberg attended the event.
